image.altText: A man sitting at his computer

props.synopsis: More Australians are working from home and the flexible arrangements make it easy to see why, but what happens if you are injured while working from home? A South Australian case provides some answers.

title.children: Council worker's WFH compensation win raises safety questions

image.altText: A man stands in a room that was destroyed in a fire with black soot on the walls and burnt furniture

props.synopsis: Sam and Miral lost their office in the recent spate of arson attacks across Adelaide, which police say are part of a war being waged by interstate organised crime syndicates trying to control the state's illicit tobacco trade.

title.children: 'We are trying to survive': Tobacco wars hit innocent business owners

image.altText: Missing man Michael Jeffrey Purse.

props.synopsis: The 32-year-old victim was last seen alive in the Adelaide CBD in February 2019.

title.children: Mark-Bry Leedham found guilty of 'cowardly murder' of Michael Purse

image.altText: Fatal truck crash Wattle Flat

props.synopsis: Two women die and several others are injured in a multi-vehicle crash on the Fleurieu Peninsula.

title.children: Two dead, seven others injured in multi-vehicle crash south of Adelaide

image.altText: Three deer near infrastructure

props.synopsis: About 20,000 feral deer have been removed from South Australia over the past two years, but stakeholders say the pests' breeding rate means that will have little impact unless efforts are doubled.

title.children: Government launches plan to eradicate feral deer from Adelaide amid warnings funding runs out in 2025

image.altText: An elderly man with glasses holding a baby while sitting. Second photo a man holds up a glass of beer in a pub.

props.synopsis: The South Australian government is concerned the evidence of a top doctor due to appear at an inquest into three ramping-related deaths could cause embarrassment, the Supreme Court has been told.

title.children: SA government 'trying to control information flow' to inquest, court told

image.altText: Coastal scene with road in foreground, ocean and headland to left, and green on right, with rocket, buildings seen in distance

props.synopsis: Years of community protesting hasn't stopped SA's planning minister granting final approval to allow the company behind a rocket launching project to continue with its space exploration mission.

title.children: Rocket launching complex on SA coast given final approval despite environmental concerns

image.altText: RBA governor Michele Bullock at a press conference.

props.synopsis: Tens, perhaps even hundreds of thousands of Australians waiting for interest rates to start falling will have to keep waiting for some time — potentially a long while.

title.children: Interest rates might fall in February … but don't bet the house on it

image.altText: The Israeli PM sitting next to his defence minister at a function.

props.synopsis: Mr Netanyahu announced the decision in a video statement, saying "full trust is required between the prime minister and the minister of defence".

title.children: Netanyahu sacks defence minister Gallant over 'crisis of trust' on Israel's wars in Gaza and Lebanon

props.synopsis: Follow live as the US decides if Donald Trump or Kamala Harris will win the presidency.

title.children: Watch the ABC News Channel's live coverage of the US election

image.altText: A person in a jacket expressing support for the CFMEU.

props.synopsis: Several workers in the construction sector say they will not speak to the CFMEU administrator about their experiences with the union because insufficient legal protections mean they fear retribution.

title.children: Construction insiders fear speaking out against CFMEU without whistleblower protections

image.altText: A an orange and yellow sunrise over Brisbane.

props.synopsis: The Bureau of Meteorology is warning vast parts of the east of the country will experience above-average temperatures, raising fire risks from today.

title.children: Bureau warns of 'shock to the system' as parts of country to feel their first taste of high summer temperatures

image.altText: An older man sits at a table looking at a letter.

props.synopsis: A pair of boarding houses in the heart of Sydney are being redeveloped into luxury homes. But elderly residents who have lived there for decades fear they have nowhere to go.

title.children: Sav is being evicted from his home of 56 years. It's likely he will have to move far away to avoid homelessness

image.altText: Queen Camilla wearing a jewel crown and jewel necklace in a white dress

props.synopsis: Queen Camilla has been forced to pull out of her planned engagements this week due to a chest infection.

title.children: Queen Camilla pulls out of planned engagements due to chest infection

image.altText: Jagga Smith runs with the ball

props.synopsis: The 2024 AFL draft is right around the corner and promises to be one of the most unpredictable in years. Here are our rankings of the 30 best talents set to be drafted this year.

title.children: AFL draft top 30: Ranking the best prospects set to take the league by storm

image.altText: An extremely thin girl wearing a black leotard in a dancer's pose in front of a blue wall, face blurred.

props.synopsis: An occupational therapist tells a Perth court that a severely malnourished girl, whose parents are on trial for allegedly starving her, was reluctant to answer personal questions and had "reduced maturity and "reduced problem solving".

title.children: Emaciated 16yo sat on mother’s lap for a story, trial of parents accused of starving her is told

image.altText: A smart tv with various streaming app logos on display.

props.synopsis: The federal government has quietly delayed plans to introduce local content requirements for major streaming platforms, with no indication of when it might return to work on the policy.

title.children: Australian content rules for streaming giants put on ice

image.altText: A woman looking at a student wearing VR glasses.

props.synopsis: For the first time last year students across Victoria were asked a simple but complicated question, have you experienced racism?

title.children: Only Victoria and NSW ask students about racism at school

image.altText: A green square over a few men in a crowd

props.synopsis: This hi-res panoramic image taken from the press pen at one of Donald Trump's final rallies before the election shows, in detail, just how much of a circus these events really are.

title.children: Alt-right media, fanatics and that orange vest. Explore the faces in the crowd at a Trump rally

image.altText: Fire

props.synopsis: The south-west Queensland town of Dirranbandi was evacuated due to a fast-moving bushfire.

title.children: Residents evacuate south-west Queensland town as bushfire burns nearby

image.altText: A yellow Hezbollah flag, featuring an arm reaching up to a rifle, seen above a sea of people.

props.synopsis: The Australian Federal Police says 14 people are now being investigated over Hezbollah flags being flown at a Melbourne protest in the wake of the listed terror group's leader being assassinated.

title.children: More people under investigation for display of Hezbollah 'terror symbols' at Melbourne protest

image.altText: A jockey kisses a golden trophy after the Melbourne Cup.

props.synopsis: Knight's Choice's win in the Melbourne Cup stuns almost everyone at Flemington, including the jockey, as the favourites fall by the wayside.

title.children: Robbie Dolan rides to Melbourne Cup dreamland on Knight's Choice

image.altText: The exterior of a building with a sign that reads "Lyneham High School".

props.synopsis: According to an email sent to parents and carers the school went into a precautionary lockdown after some students came onto school grounds in a "heightened" state and using threatening behaviour.

title.children: Canberra school hires security guard, locks some entrances after students use 'threatening' behaviour

image.altText: People walking past the outside of the Reserve Bank of Australia in Sydney.

props.synopsis: The Reserve Bank of Australia has kept interest rates on hold at 4.35 per cent for its eighth-straight meeting despite inflation falling to its lowest level in almost four years.

title.children: RBA not ruling out future interest rate rises after warning inflation 'remains too high'

image.altText: Group of men in all black holding a sign, the Australian flag and the National Socialist Network flag

props.synopsis: NSW Police said it was investigating a suspected white supremacist rally after photos of people holding banners at Wollumbin Mountain were posted to social media last week.

title.children: Suspected neo-Nazi rally now under NSW Police investigation, days after photos were posted online

image.altText: A man in a suit walks with other people behind him.

props.synopsis: ABC News boss Justin Stevens has issued apologies to audiences, commandos and a former US drug enforcement official after receiving the interim findings from an investigation into the 2022 Line of Fire reports. While the review found errors weren't a deliberate effort, it identified the use of additional gunshots and the potentially misleading use of a quote.

title.children: ABC apologises for Afghan war series errors but interim review clears it of deliberately misleading audiences

image.altText: A sign outside of the University of Canterbury in New Zealand.

props.synopsis: Some students were forced to vomit out of windows because they were unable to make it to the toilet and others reportedly missed or had to leave exams on Monday due to illness.

title.children: 'Bad chicken souvlaki' leaves hundreds of students unwell at New Zealand university during exam time

image.altText: a woman flanked by others entering court

props.synopsis: In December 2021, six children died and three were injured after the jumping castle they were playing on became airborne, with the tragedy making international headlines.

title.children: 'Mini tornado' lifted jumping castle 20m into air, leading to deaths of six Tasmanian students, court hears

image.altText: Gout Gout in action for Australia

props.synopsis: Gout Gout's manager James Templeton reveals the teenage sensation is likely to skip the 2026 Commonwealth Games, is planning for a US training camp with Olympic champion Noah Lyles, and explains why comparisons to Usain Bolt are being avoided at all costs.

title.children: Gout Gout's manager on training with Noah Lyles, skipping the Comm Games and comparisons to 'UB'

image.altText: a huge crocodile biting on a chicken.

props.synopsis: A scientist hopes to learn more about the exact age of the iconic record-breaking saltwater crocodile Cassius, believed to be up to 120 years old, after the croc died at the weekend.

title.children: Investigation begins to learn exact age of dead crocodile, Cassius

image.altText: Russian naval officers are welcomed in Indonesia

props.synopsis: Indonesia begins its first-ever joint naval drills with Russia while simultaneously conducting military exercises with Australian forces.

title.children: 'Enemies to no-one': Indonesia starts military drills with both Russia and Australia

image.altText: A person watches the news bulletin.

props.synopsis: North Korea fires at least seven short-range ballistic missiles off its east coast, Japan's defence minister says, shortly after Pyongyang condemns military drills by its rivals.

title.children: North Korea fires multiple short-range missiles in protest at rivals' military drills

image.altText: Man holds wooden satellite

props.synopsis: The palm-sized LignoSat is tasked with demonstrating the cosmic potential of the renewable material as humans explore living in space.

title.children: World's first wooden satellite, developed in Japan, heads to space

image.altText: Cynthia Erivo and Ariana Grande sit for an interview for the film Wicked.

props.synopsis: It was an emotional moment for Ariana Grande, Cynthia Erivo and the rest of the cast of Wicked when they shared their creation with fans for the first time at the world premiere in Sydney on Sunday.

title.children: Cast of Wicked movie confident it will live up to fans' expectations as it premieres in the Land of Oz
